citation: Proclamation under the Highways Act 1951 and the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Highways Act 1951 and the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 3 of the Highways Act 1951 and section 7 of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 â€“

        (a) notify the dedication as a highway of the land of the Crown specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation; and
        (b) notify that the boundaries of the highway are the boundaries specified in that Schedule; and
        (c) declare the portion of road specified in Schedule 2 to this proclamation to be a subsidiary road, classified as a main road, for the purposes of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 ; and
        (d) declare that the portions of Colebrook Main Road specified in Schedule 3 to this proclamation cease to be a subsidiary road for the purposes of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 ; and
        (e) amend the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1970, No. 67, by omitting from Part I of the Second Schedule to that proclamation the item relating to the Colebrook Main Road and substituting the item specified in Schedule 4 to this proclamation; and
        (f) revoke the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1992, No. 139, insofar as it relates to Colebrook Main Road; and
        (f) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
5 July 2016

A. M. BLOW

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

M. T. (RENE) HIDDING

Minister for Infrastructure

SCHEDULE 1 - Dedication of Crown land as Highway

PART 1 - Description

All those lands from a midpoint on Richmond Road (also known as Colebrook Main Road) approximately 235 metres west of Blair Street, Richmond, to a midpoint on the Colebrook Road (also known as Colebrook Main Road) approximately 231 metres north of Victoria Street, Richmond, including the Middle Tea Tree Road junction and Franklin Street junction, shown as Lot 1, Lot 2, and Lot 3 and shaded grey on Plan No. 10253 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 2 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation.

PART 2 - Plan

SCHEDULE 2 - Road declared to be a subsidiary road

Name  Description  Length in kilometres  Colebrook Main Road  From a point on Richmond Road (Colebrook Main Road), Richmond approximately 235 metres west of Blair Street, Richmond, to a point on Colebrook Road (Colebrook Main Road) approximately 65 metres north of the junction of Franklin Street, Richmond and Colebrook Road (Colebrook Main Road), Richmond.  1.24
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            


SCHEDULE 3 - Road ceasing to be a subsidiary road

Name  Description  Length in kilometres  Colebrook Main Road  From the junction of Richmond Road (Colebrook Main Road) and Bridge Street, Richmond and Colebrook Road (Colebrook Main Road), Richmond, to the junction of Franklin Street, Richmond and Colebrook Road (Colebrook Main Road), Richmond, via Bridge Street and Franklin Street, Richmond  1.39
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             


SCHEDULE 4 - Definition and length of Colebrook Main Road

  Description  Length  Colebrook  From the Tasman Highway near Belbins Road, Cambridge, to the junction with Tea Tree Road (Tea Tree Secondary Road) near Campania, via Cambridge and the deviation at Richmond.  13.47 (21.67 kilometres)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 13 July 2016

This proclamation is administered in the Department of State Growth.
